via aylesbury
parallel to the east west rail corrider - a new rail line between the two cities

documents.title: this evening 's view from bbc oxford
text: managing editor tim boswell has snapped this lovely view of the sky from bbc oxford 's third floor

documents.title: man seriously injured in witney crash
text: yesterday at about 09:05 a silver ford ka was involved in a crash opposite the entrance to witney lakes resort , downs road , witney .
the 27-year-old man driving the ka sustained serious injuries and is currently being treated in the john radcliffe hospital in oxford .
pc wayne martin said : i would like to speak to anyone who witnessed the collision or has any information which could assist the investigation to please contact the police . ''

documents.title: man taken to hospital after living room fire
text: at 05:09 firefighters were called to reports of a living room on fire at marylands green , chiselhampton .
the living room at the rear of the property was alight but firefighters prevented the fire spreading to the rest of the property .
the resident was woken by his smoke alarm and left the building before the fire service arrived .
he sustained a burn to his hand and was taken to hospital suffering from the effects of smoke inhalation .
the cause of the fire was found to be a wood burning stove that had spread to the timber built extension .

documents.title: couple 'may hold clue ' to cyclist death
text: couple 'may hold clue ' to cyclist death

documents.title: oxford to cambridge expressway predicted cost up to £ 3.5bn
text: a new road between oxford and cambridge could cost between £ 3.2bn and £ 3.5bn .
the project , dubbed the oxford to cambridge expressway , is part of plans to invest in infrastructure to promote economic growth .
chancellor philip hammond committed the government to investing an additional £ 27m to the project in the autumn statement .
the predicted cost was announced in a new report which identifies proposed options for where the road will go .

documents.title: witness appeal in cyclist murder inquiry
text: witnesses to a fatal attack on a cyclist in oxford city centre that led to a murder investigation are being sought by police .
six people were arrested in connection with the death of eamonn anderson , 56 , who was assaulted in high street at about 23:30 gmt on 25 october .
he died in hospital on 11 november and iman st clair , 18 , of kestrel crescent , oxford , has been charged with murder .
now after reviewing cctv footage police are appealing to potential witnesses .
a 23-year-old man , an 18-year-old man , and three 17-year-old boys , all from oxford , have also been arrested on sus of murder .

documents.title: didcot animal sanctuary needs to find a new home for 200 homeless pets
text: didcot animal sanctuary , which has enjoyed a rent-free existence on hill farm in appleford for three years , has been given its marching orders .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: wheelchair grannies enjoy taking to the ice
text: the christmas season is upon us and many people will be taking to the ice to get in the festive period .
pensioners are no different , and the order of st john 's care trust organised ice skating for its wheelchair-user residents .

documents.title: 'it could be anything , anywhere '
text: a dementia patient with chest pain , a man with prostate cancer who feels faint , a feverish baby and an alcoholic who has hit his head all patients attended to by one specialist paramedic in one day in north oxfordshire and north buckinghamshire .
the bbc spent the day with georgette , who has to be prepared to attend anybody , anywhere , in any given day .

documents.title: scas missing response time target
text: figures for march this year showed south central ambulance service was responding to 69.1 % of category 1 calls within the eight-minute target .
the government has said 75 % of all life-threatening calls must be answered within the eight minutes .
but as you can see from march , only one trust - west midlands - managed to get over the 75 % mark .
the average response time for the whole of england was 66.5 % .

documents.title: a guide to understanding the types of ambulance call
text: control room operators are responsible for putting emergency calls into categories which make it easier to determine how urgent an ambulance is needed at the scene .
each category has a response time - with the quickest response being eight minutes for life threatening emergencies .

red 1 and red 2 are the most urgent categories , with the first being for respiratory/cardiac arrest where two resources are dispatched to the incident and the second for all other life threatening situations .
then there are green 1 , 2 , 3 and 4 .
green 1 and 2 are for serious but not life threatening calls with a response time of 20-30 minutes and blue lights and sirens .
green 3 and 4 are neither serious nor life threatening .
an operator will give an assessment over the phone for green 3 within 20 minutes and the response time for both categories is 60 minutes with no blue lights .

documents.title: travel update : bump on a34
text: we 've been told there are delays on the a34 southbound between the peartree and botley interchanges due to a bump , which has left debris on the road .
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: where can you find churchill 's secret army training bunker ?
text: during the second world war 3,500 people were secretly trained to kill potential nazi invaders in coleshill .
although little remains of the training camp , there are a few stealthy clues to the site 's history .
the secret bunker at coleshill near faringdon where churchill 's secret army was trained .
@ twitterid

documents.title: oxfordshire nuclear facility faces 'uncertain future ' post-brexit
text: researchers at a largely eu-funded nuclear fusion centre in culham are `` extremely nervous '' about future financing and freedom of movement post-brexit .
five scientists at the joint european torus ( jet ) experimental nuclear fusion reactor , have already returned to continental europe after britain voted to leave the eu .
about 100 scientists from outside britain work at the site , and professor steve cowley said many are concerned .
he said : `` we 've certainly lost a few people already - these are highly-talented people at the very forefront of scientific discovery and we ca n't afford to lose them .

`` this is the world 's greatest fusion lab and if we do n't find a way to make an agreement with europe , this will all go - and our lead in this area will have been dissipated and i think that 's an enormous shame . ''
`` we 'd be bonkers to close it down , and europe would be bonkers to close it down , but these are uncertain times . ''
it 's the largest single research centre funded by the eu in britain .
author: David Shukman
Science editor, BBC News

documents.title: public 's help needed to identify 'mystery raf bunker '
text: historians are asking the public to `` help solve the puzzle '' of a mystery bunker on a former raf site in oxfordshire .
the bunker , which is partially underground , is on the site of the former raf bicester , which was a second world war bomber training site .
historic england 's clare charlesworth said : `` this irregularly shaped brick shelter is one of many original features still remaining on the former raf bicester site .
`` it is special because the other brick shelters on the site do not have the same damp-proofing measures to keep them watertight .
`` it 's possible that it was partially buried and housed technical equipment , but we are appealing for information from the public to help us solve this puzzle . ''
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: benson second coldest temperatures in country
text: the oxfordshire village of benson was the second-coldest place in the country last night , with temperatures dipping to as low as -9c , but the town was beaten to lowest temperature by pennybridge in powys , wales , which recorded -9.4c .
it was cold in other areas of the county as well , weather watcher farmer m recorded -9.3c on his car in stonesfield , in west oxfordshire .
now that i 've teased you here 's what 'farmer m ' shared .
phil
it was a very chilly -9c here last night .
this morning it will remain below freezing with some fog patches around then clear skies later ^km

documents.title: oxfordshire weather : cold start but sunshine throughout
text: it 's the coldest start we 've seen this season , but the pay-off is it 'll be nice and sunny during the day .
there is some chance we 'll see some icy fog patches in rural oxfordshire , and temperatures wo n't be getting any higher than 4c .
tonight wo n't be as cold as yesterday evening but it is possible we 'll see -6c in some rural areas .

documents.title: get your thick socks on
text: well it 's absolutely baltic this morning .
another `` bracing '' start and i 'm sure we 'll hear more about the overnight temperatures across the county later today , i 'm currently cuddled up next to the heater and am waiting to thaw .
but , more importantly it 's wednesday , and like mid-weeks before it we will plow on through .
we will , of course , be bringing you the latest news , sports , weather and travel until 18.00 .
as always , we 'd like to see your photos from across the county for this week 's oxfordshire 's big picture .
above is an example from pauline massey , who snapped a quiet scene in osney island yesterday morning .
you can send you snaps to us , as always , by email .
author: Alex Regan
South Online
